title: Deputy Tadier: Bailiff 'overstepped the mark'
text:
Deputy Montfort Tadier Deputy Montfort Tadier has said the Bailiff 'overstepped the mark' and 'got the wrong end of the stick' after he threw the deputy out of the States Chamber yesterday for an 'offensive' comment about Jesus.
The Deputy was in the middle of making a speech about increasing tax for the rich when he said "Of course he (Jesus) would be at the Tory Party Conference" when the Bailiff interrupted him and asked him to withdraw the comment.
Tadier says he was using rhetoric and was making the suggestion ironically.
Before I could finish my train of thought "Or would he?" I was interrupted by the Bailiff, who said my comment was offensive and asked me to withdraw the comment.
â€“ Deputy Montfort Tadier It has been said that others have commented that this is not the first time the Bailiff has 'overstepped the mark' and this incident will 'add to growing calls for the States to be chaired by someone other than a senior member of Judiciary.'
Deputy Tadier describes his comment as "standard political discourse" and is 'frustrated' that he was impeded in doing his job.
It is important members are able to express themselves freely "without fear or prejudice" he says.
The Bailiff, William Bailhache, expelled the Deputy for one hour because he wouldn't retract the comment.
